title: [ITDEV-106] Add manage.py cmd for updating stripe billing metadata
body:
### What does this do and why?
Accounting would like to have certain metadata fields added to **all**  stripe customers and regularly updated. ITDEV-82 took care of that for any newly created or modified companies. This PR would add a manage.py command that would update 3 metadata fields: company id, billing plan name, and zuora long id for all customers with `stripe_customer_id`s. My plan is to [schedule this command to run everyday via cron](https://github.com/urbanairship/chef_configs/compare/add_stripe_billing_metadata_cron_job).

### Corresponding JavaScript/other changes
* Scheduling the cmd to run daily via cron - https://github.com/urbanairship/chef_configs/compare/add_stripe_billing_metadata_cron_job

### Testing
* [ ] I wrote tests covering these changes

### Verification steps
* None, change is not customer facing
* I'll run the cmd once this change is fully deployed

title: [ECOMM-118] Adds tracking to registration success page
body:
### What does this do and why?

Adds tracking code to registration success page. Users previously had to go through this page in order to sign up, and we have some tracking code in place on the airship-ui side to track when the signup form is submitted. However, we introduced a signup flow where users submit a form directly from the marketing site which bypasses the signup form on `go`. These signups are not being tracked in reports where we are filtering by `sg_plan_name` so that metric is added here in the view.

### Corresponding JavaScript/other changes

Nop

### Testing
* [ ] I wrote tests covering these changes

### Verification steps
* Check KissMetrics for events getting in sync, currently we have a ton of `None` for `sg_plan_name`

### Screenshots (if appropriate)

![refactoring-fox](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/59454/17039525/f09f20dc-4f68-11e6-9360-de3d49d9f9b0.gif)

title: [GAG-1501] Added underlying duplicate-to-Goatzart support.
body:
### What does this do and why?

Per [GAG-1501](https://tofurkey.urbanairship.com/browse/GAG-1501), this adds the underlying support to enable duplicating an existing NuPW push _into_ a new Goatzart push.

This transforms the UI State v1 into a UI State v2, as well as handling all the Rich Push changes.

This is not public-facing yet (dark launch). The API the JS will use to trigger this is part of the pending [GAG-1502](https://tofurkey.urbanairship.com/browse/GAG-1502) work.

_It also includes a potentially controversial change to `dotpath.get_value_at_dotpath` to add support for `list`/`tuple` types. I grepped around & we're using this in a very limited manner in the rest of the codebase. Buyer beware._

### Corresponding JavaScript/other changes
* N/A

### Additional notes for reviewers
* N/A

### Testing
* [x] I wrote tests covering these changes

### Verification steps
* None, though it could be triggered from the shell to hand-test a push or two.

### Screenshots (if appropriate)

![snail_transformer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449/17004870/af478434-4e9c-11e6-86a5-130015113527.gif)

title: Fetch more settings from the environment
body:
### What does this do and why?

Checks environment variables for more settings. This helps us move forward with containerizing airship, since dependence on settings override _files_ isn't a pattern we love in that new world.

This should cause no changes in prod as it stands today. Please be critical if I appear to be wrong about that.

### Testing
* [x] I wrote tests covering these changes

### Verification steps
* Maybe: write a script to run through settings and print all the impacted stuff out. We can run it before and after deploying to admin to make sure nothing changed.

title: Multi-bundle
body:
### What does this do and why?

Updates airship to place a script tag per entry-point rather than a JSON blob to be resolved by JS, which allows us to build and serve page-specific bundles rather than a monolithic one across the site.

### Corresponding JavaScript/other changes

[Multi-bundle](https://github.com/urbanairship/airship-ui/pull/1878)

### Additional notes for reviewers
* Some of the template changes (mostly the `js_context` ones) may not be necessary, but I wanted everything to be uniform
* I am reversing the deps because their order matters ("behaviors" needs to be first) and didn't want to replicate that across templates
* In order to test this locally, you will also need the `multi-bundle` branch of airship-ui

### Testing
* [ ] I wrote tests covering these changes

### Verification steps
* Verify that literally everything works

### Screenshots (if appropriate)

![dodrio](https://media.giphy.com/media/eDGIo8arf0vXG/giphy.gif)

title: [Hack Week] Removed some of our dependance on `helib`
body:
### What does this do and why?

`helib` is a repeated source of pain for the Web team. This tries to reduce our usage of `helib`, with the eventual goal of removing it completely.

Things this doesn't cover:
* The legacy tags API (`airship/api/endpoints/tags.py` & its tests) - Nate is working on ripping this out AFAIK
* `DeviceToken` (`airship/api/utils.py`, `airship/apps/composer/forms.py`, `airship/apps/push/forms.py`, `airship/apps/templatetags/lr_for_dt.py`, `airship/introspection/views.py` & tests for many of these) - Looks like we're using the models to get `DeviceToken` information. Unsure if there's an alternate/better source these days.
* `airship/apps/signals.py` - Looks like we're deleting things out of a shared cache
* `airship/api/feedbacklib.py` - We're using the ``queue` for a thread-safe queue. Unsure if this is necessary here.

If you know things about any of the above, I'd love to hear ideas on how to kill more of those usages.

### Corresponding JavaScript/other changes
* `webenv` will need updating to incorporate the `settings.REACTOR_CLIENT['argon']` addition
* Unknown if `chef_configs` need updating? 

### Additional notes for reviewers
* N/A

### Testing
* [ ] I wrote tests covering these changes

### Verification steps
* Our unit tests barely cover any of this (at one point, the code was broke & there were only 10 `venkman` errors). Which means we need to do a ton of hand-testing.
* And because this relies on all the other services, `stag` isn't going to cut it.

### Screenshots (if appropriate)

![popcorn_time_3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449/16748220/799c5e60-4788-11e6-85d1-a3b86d531b74.gif)

title: Creating a setup.py so we can easily install airship into a container
body:
### What does this do and why?
Sets up a setup.py for airship, using the requirements.txt for the 'install_requires' section.

The idea being that we create the airship deploy image using some sequence like the following:
- git checkout airship
- python setup.py install --root tmp
- mv tmp / inside the docker union filesystem
- finalize image and upload to registry

Later, containers may be started simply by specifying the ACI name/version.


One detail is that we're planning on baking the dependencies into a step prior to this process. This process is explicitly about airship code itself.

### Corresponding JavaScript/other changes
None.
### Additional notes for reviewers
* Maybe there's a better way to package a python service these days? Who knows.

### Testing
* [x] I did a setup.py install --root test to make sure that the application was decompressed appropriately

### Verification steps
* Will need to create an entrypoint on $PATH that lives in this repository.

### Screenshots (if appropriate)

title: PPDX-725: Update to use new pyreactor with migrated richpush rpc utils
body:
For https://tofurkey.urbanairship.com/browse/PPDX-725

Switch from using code that used to live in the no-longer-being-built `richpush_rpc_client` to it's new location in `reactor` (aka pyreactor-client). As airship is already using a `reactor` version >= 3.9.0, this just involves switching any references of `richpush.rpc` to `reactor.richpush.rpc`.

title: Migrated logging from fileConfig to dictConfig.
body:
### What does this do and why?

The current state of affairs is that Airship uses the old ``logging.config.fileConfig`` + INI files to configure logging. There are lots of edge-cases to this & it's painful to maintain. Edge-cases include:

* ``qualname`` is required to map dotted pathnames
* Strange naming/syntax on certain options
* INI files are flat, so the config is all over the place
* Poor documentation
* Rarely seen/used elsewhere in the community/documentation

This updates us to use Django's built-in logging configuration bits (utilizing ``dictConfig``). This is easier to read & maintain.

### Corresponding JavaScript/other changes
**Nope.**

### Additional notes for reviewers
**Nope.**

### Testing
* [ ] I wrote tests covering these changes
* [x] I ran the full test suite and it passed:

*Mon Feb  2 21:48:12 UTC 2015*
```
Ran 2119 tests in 264.628s

OK
```

### Verification steps
* Click around & ensure errors make it to Sentry.
* Monitor the log files to make sure the output is consistent with the previous configuration.

### Screenshots (if appropriate)

![a_little_organ](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449/5927866/88fed45e-a63b-11e4-8466-b823b2bf1680.gif)
